title: Is the Squier Affinity PJ Bass a good guitar? - Quora

response.answer_text: While I don’t own that particular bass I do have a similar Squier Vintage Modified short scale Jaguar Bass and I think it’s adequate. The Affinity series is a budget line within the budget Squier brand and is typically intended to be a somebody’s “first” bass. Since you’ve been playing for a year already I’d think you’d be ready for something a bit higher end than that. Is your current bass functional and playable? If so, I’d wait and either save up some more money for a better bass or try to find something decent come along in the used market If I was looking to buy a new bass for about $200.00 with the PJ pickup configuration I’d probably buy a Yamaha TRBX174. The Yamaha has better quality control and features.

If that is your budget, then yes it is. You can always put CTS pots, or even change the pickups later on and mod it to your satisfaction. Eventually, you may be end up frustrated with it being a Squier and not a Fender Funny thing , Whenever I sit in with someone new, they always ask what kind of bass I play. What if I suck, but I have an American Elite 5 string? I must be real good right? Wrong. I play a modded MIM Fender Jazz, and I am not ashamed of taking it out anywhere. Use what you got, and make your music
